messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Building fire. Residential fire at 3722 Caracas Court.
Can you confirm the address?
Yes, 3722 Caracas Court, cross street of Cornwood, beat 803.
Alright, we're dispatching units now. Battalion 2, engine 2, engine 8, truck 2, fireman 1, and volunteers are on the way. Are you safe?
Yes, but there's an active shooting as well. Officer down, need EMS immediately.
Everyone back away from the scene immediately. All units, clear all traffic, emergency only. Active shooting in progress. Officer down. Do you have a location for the shooter?
Shooter is on the corner of Caraway and Caracas.
Understood. All units, be advised, shooter located at Caraway and Caracas. Proceed with caution. Engine 2, have you cleared the scene?
Engine 2 has cleared the scene. No injuries reported.
10-4. All units, give me a par.
Engine 2 and truck 2 have par, no injuries reported.
10-4. Fireman 1, county EMS is responding with two units. Everyone stay off the channel except for the first responding unit.
Fireman 1 here. We have picked up Truck 2's company and evacuated the area. Standing by at Bentley and Woodhill.
10-4, Bentley and Woodhill. EMS, are you on scene?
Yes, we're here. We're trying to reach the officer down now.
10-4. Med units, proceed with caution. Scene is secure for medics.
Med unit approaching the officer down. Do we have another medic?
10-4, another medic is on the way. All TFD units, back out of the area. Shooter is still active.
We have a visual on the shooter. We're backing away now.
10-4. All units, back away from the scene immediately.
Units are out of the area. Waiting for further instructions.
Command, Fire Med 1, go ahead.
Shooter is down. Scene is secure. Need units to move in. Suspect has been hit several times.
10-4. All units, proceed with caution. Secure the scene and assist the injured.
Med unit approaching the officer down. Shooter is secure.
10-4. Engine 2, are you back on scene?
Engine 2 arriving back on scene. Laying line now for the house fire.
Copy that. All units, continue with fire suppression and assist with any injuries.
